org.contentmine.image.pixel

Class MainPixelProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.contentmine.image.pixel.MainPixelProcessor

  • public class MainPixelProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    manager for all pixel operations. often contained within ImageProcessor used to be PixelIslandList but that became over-complex. Also the pixelIslandList might be null but this shouldn't be. NOTE: setters return PixelProcessor so they can be chained, e.g. PixelProcessor processor = new PixelProcessor(image).setMaxisland(3).setOutputDir(file)
    Author:
    pm286

        messy. If we have set thinning to null, then we don't use superthinning
        Parameters:

      • getOrCreatePixelIslandList

        public PixelIslandList getOrCreatePixelIslandList()
        get PixelIslandList. create it if it doesn't exist. this default is NOT to superthin after creating islands
        Returns:

      • getOrCreatePixelIslandList

        public PixelIslandList getOrCreatePixelIslandList(boolean superThinning)
        get pixelIslandList. if not existing, do floodfill on pixels if superthinning (i.e. cleaning thick edges and pixelNuclei) is required carry it out here. Ideally it should be with the Z-S thinning, but the code is written for pixels after pixelIslands are created.
        Parameters:
        superThinning -
        Returns:
